channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hamas Official Says Group Is Ready for ‘Dialogue With America’
item.description: In a rare move hours after the cease-fire took effect, one senior Hamas official said the group wants to engage the new Trump administration.

item.title: Food and Other Vital Aid Surges Into Gaza After 15 Months of Scarcity
item.description: Hunger has gripped the enclave, besieged by Israel, and the surge is a step toward alleviating it. But with Hamas asserting its grip on Gaza, question...

item.title: Meet Craig Underwood, the 82-year-old farming millionaire whose chilis made sriracha hot until a mysterious fight destroyed the business
item.description: Underwood answered a random call for chili peppers from the man who’d go on to became California’s sriracha mogul. Now they don’t speak.

item.title: Here Are Trump’s Expected Executive Orders
item.description: The incoming president’s team said he would take unilateral action on a variety of fronts during his first hours in office, including 10 executive ord...

item.title: Airborne Lead and Chlorine Levels Soared as L.A. Wildfires Raged
item.description: The findings give new insight into the dangers of urban wildfires that burn plastics and other chemicals in homes and property.

item.title: Day One of the new Trump Administration, and things are looking good for China
item.description: Trump used to be actively hostile to China but with Musk at his side there has been a complete reversal.

item.title: Live Updates: As Cease-Fire Takes Hold, Gazans Return to Destroyed Homes
item.description: Gazans were surveying the vast damage to their neighborhoods on Monday as anxious Israelis awaited news about the condition of the hostages.

item.title: At Least 80 Dead in Colombia Amid a New Surge of Violence
item.description: Thousands have fled clashes between armed groups on the border with Venezuela, dashing hopes of peace in Colombia.

item.title: Gulf Coast Braces for Rare Winter Storm as Brutal Cold Settles Across U.S.
item.description: Snow and ice may bring major travel disruptions and power outages in the South starting Monday evening, forecasters warned.

item.title: Biden Pardons 5 Members of His Family in Final Minutes in Office
item.description: Mr. Biden emphasized that he did not believe his family did anything wrong, but he feared political attacks by Donald J. Trump.

item.title: Scores of Senior Diplomats Are Leaving Posts as Trump Takes Office
item.description: The departures are common when a transition takes place, but it is now happening more quickly and on a larger scale than under previous administration...

item.title: Elon Musk lets slip he may have secretly had help in what critics say is the ‘biggest gaming fraud in history’
item.description: A bizarre scandal is brewing about whether the entrepreneur lied about being one of the world's best video game players. Now evidence emerged in which...

item.title: Largest-ever Ozempic and GLP-1 drug study finds they lower risk of 42 health conditions, including heart attacks and Alzheimer’s disease
item.description: The study included nearly 2 million patients, making it the largest ever conducted on this group of glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonists.

item.title: A woman purchased a vacant Hawaiian lot for about $22,000. She was surprised to see a $500,000 home was built on it by mistake
item.description: Annaleine “Anne” Reynolds was waiting for the right time to do something with the property—until her realtor called to tell her the news.

item.title: At Least 80 Dead in Colombia Amid a New Surge of Violence
item.description: Thousands have fled clashes between armed groups on the border with Venezuela, dashing hopes of peace in Colombia.
